original: Lindblad, Johan Emanuel, distriktschef, Göteborg, f. 5/4/83 i Borgsjö, Västern. 1., av Johan L. o. Anna Jonsson. G. 20’ m. Elin Fornander. Barn: Ingrid f. 21. — Mog:ex. 01, ex. fr. telegrafv. assist :kurs 03, kurs f. ut-bildn. av aspir. t. h. befälskurser v. SJ 11-12, stud. v. HHS ht. 12. E. skrivbitr. v. SJ 02, e. o. stat:skriv. 03, ord. dito 05, kont:skriv. 10, bokh. 15, not. 18, sekr. 19, förste sekr. 20, tf. överinsp. f. säkerh :tjänsten 23, över-insp. 30, byråch. f. järnv :styr. kanslibyrå 32, dess drifttj :byrå 32, distr :ch. 38. Led. av kommunik :väs. lönend 32-37, komm. f. kiassif. av trafikverkens anst. 36, ordf. i styr. f. Järnv :män-nens livförsäkr :fören. 34-38, i styr. f. Järnv :männens vilohemsfören. 34-35, styr:led. i Lysekils Järnv. A-B 38-39, Uddevalla-Lelångens samt Borås-Jön-köp. dito 38-40, Falkenbergs dito 39-40, Gbgs o. Bohus läns turisttrafikför-en. fr. 38. Red. f. tidn. Dopparedagen fr. 22, huvudred, f. Nord. Järnbane-tidskr. 30-37. RNO, RVO, KDD02gr, KFinlVRO, RNS :t001kl.
translated: Lindblad, Johan Emanuel, district manager, Gothenburg, b. 5/4/83 in Borgsjö, Västernorrland, son of Johan L. and Anna Jonsson. Married on 20xx to Elin Fornander. Children: Ingrid b. 1921. Former occupations: telegraph road assistant examiner until 1901, telegraph road assistant examiner course in 1903, course for outbound training of aspiring officers at SJ (Swedish Railways) in 1911-1912, studied at HHS (Stockholm School of Economics) in the autumn of 1912. Started working as a clerk at SJ in 1902, became a temporary state clerk in 1903, regular state clerk in 1905, clerk typist in 1910, bookkeeper in 1915, notary in 1918, secretary in 1919, chief secretary in 1920, acting inspector for security service in 1923, inspector in 1930, head of the railway board office bureau in 1932, head of the board's operating bureau in 1932, district manager in 1938. Member of the Communication Facilities Committee from 1932 to 1937, commissioner for classification of the railway employee's service from 1936, chairman of the board for the Railwaymen's Life Insurance Association from 1934 to 1938, board member for the Railwaymen's Rest Home Association from 1934 to 1935, board member of Lysekils Järnvägar AB from 1938 to 1939, Uddevalla-Lelången as well as Borås-Jönköping railways in 1938-1940, Falkenberg's railways in 1939-1940, Gothenburg and Bohus County Tourist Traffic Association from 1938. Editor for the newspaper "Dopparedagen" from 1922, chief editor for the Nordic Railway Journal from 1930 to 1937. Recipient of Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Royal Swedish Order of Vasa, Knight of Order of the Lion of Finland, Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, 1st Class.
